Description: Set the name of the server as it would appear publicly.
DefaultValue: AMP Powered ARK Survival Evolved Server

Description: If specified, players must provide this password to join the server.

Must be changed within AMP. AMP provides a random password, but that can be overriden if you wish. To do so, navigate to the Privacy and Security menu and click on the "Policies" tab, then enable "Allow User-defined Passwords". Next click the "Generic Config" tab and disable "Use random password". Finally enter your new Admin / RCON password in the "Remote Admin Password" field (if text field isn't showing comfirm if you had changed the settings as stated previously).
To use non-admin spectator, the server must specify a spectator password. Then any client can use these console commands: "requestspectator <password>" and "stopspectating".
Sets the player welcome message (MOTD).
Sets the time period for display of the Message of the Day (MOTD).
Sets interval for automatic saves. Setting this to 0 will cause constant saving, You can however set it to 9000000 to effectively disable it.
Sets the map for the server. If Custom is selected, Custom Map Name must also be set.
Sets a custom map for the server. "Custom" type must be selected under Map, and the map files included in ShooterGame/Content/Mods. Automatically Manage Mods can be used for this purpose.

If set, enables automatic mod download and updating (on server start). Specify the relevant mods under Mods List. Alternatively, specify them in Game.ini under the heading [ModInstaller] and with one mod per line in the format: ModIDS=<value>

Comma-separated and ordered list of IDs of mods to load (map mods will not load unless named as a "Custom" map under Custom Map Name). ONE LINE ONLY! Mod files must be in ShooterGame/Content/Mods. If "Automatically Manage Mods" is enabled, the mods listed will be installed by the server.
Specifies the maximum number of players who can be on the server at any given time.
Sets the language of the server.
Causes players who have not moved or interacted within the Kick Idle Player Period to be kicked.
Time after which characters that have not moved or interacted will be kicked (if Enable Idle Timeout is enabled).
If set, disables Valve Anti-Cheat (VAC). Only works on Windows.
If set, BattlEye will be disabled on the server.
Server player-move-physics optimization is enabled by default (improves perf) using this will disable the optimization.
Prevents wild dinos from being spawned. NOTE: you will need to wipe dinos (cheat destroywilddinows) if using this on an existing server.
If enabled, turn off the anti meshing system entirely.
If enabled, turn off the anti meshing player kills (but still allow teleporting).
If set, enables Vivox on Steam only servers. (Vivox is the default for Epic Game Store enabled servers)
Enables players borrowing game with Steam Family Sharing to connect.
Enables additional dupe protection. (Note: this could have an impact on mods, so use with caution)

DisplayName: Force Respawn Dinos on Startup (Causes lag while repopulating)
Description: Whis command will destroy all wild creatures once the server starts. (This will only destroy wild creatures that are NOT currently being tamed)
Disables Anti Speed Hack Detection.
The game is forced to use DX10 instead of DX11 by sm4. Be sure to launch it accurately, you are not going to miss out on anything. (Windows Only)

The game is forced to use Shader Model 4 instead of the Shader Model 5 as usual. Well, there is no much difference, the game still looks and feels the same, but you can obtain better performance. (Reported to increase frames but changes the game lighting). (Windows Only)
Launch option that reduces graphics and audio effects to save about 800 MB RAM, likely enabling 4GB RAM players to get past infinite-loading screens.

Lots of detailed sky features are disabled, such as clouts and starry night sky. This decreases all of those but you can still have them. You still obtain the stars, the sun, and the moon. This just helps you remove the sparkling stars that make you sightless at night.

Reduced client game memory usage by about 600 MB system and 600 MB GPU RAM! (all meshes now stream LOD's dynamically). This could potentially have a small runtime performance impact, so to use the old method (more RAM usage but no potential performance loss).

AI Controllers to once again be destroyed on Stasis, too much memory overhead to keeping them around on large maps. For servers with a lot of RAM, they can now optionally gain performance by running with this to keep the AI's in memory.
Activates NVIDIA Ansel support. When connecting to a server, this will cause most lights (lamps) to no longer function, even when powered and lit unless the server has allowed it.
Enables structure memory optimizations. NOTE: avoid using it when running structure-related mods (until they get updated) as it can break the snappoints of mod structures.
Enables the Structure Stasis Grid to improve server performance on large bases with lots of players.
Enables Crossplay (between EPIC and Steam) on Dedicated Servers.
Enables Epic Game Store only players to connect to the Dedicated Server.

DisplayName: Server Admin Logs Include Tribe Logs
Description: If enabled, will write all tribe logs (for all tribes) into the ShooterGame log files.
If enabled, all admin commands will be echoed to chat for everyone to see.
Allows tribe chat to be displayed in rcon, in addition to global chat.

DisplayName: Log Admin Commands to Chat (admins only)
Description: If enabled, all admin commands will be echoed to chat but are only visible to admins.

DisplayName: Allow Hide Damage Source from Logs
Description: Allows the hiding of damage sources in tribe logs.
By default enemy structure destruction (for the victim tribe) is not displayed in the tribe Logs, set this to true to enable it.
Makes voice chat global.
Only players near each other can see eachothers chat messages.
Players will get notified if someone joins the server.
Players will get notified if someone leaves the server.
If enabled, player HUD is always disabled.
If enabled, shows each player their crosshair.
Enables 3rd person view.
Show each player their own precise position when they view their map.
Use this to enable RPG-style popup text stat mode.
If enabled, shows hitmarkers for ranged attacks.
Prevents use of console command "gamma" in PvE mode.
Allows use of console command "gamma" in PvP mode.
If enabled, allows flying dinosaurs to pick up other dinosaurs and players if mounted by a player in PvE.
Sets the scaling factor for the experience recieved players. Higher values increase XP while lower values decrease XP.
Specifies the scaling factor for the damage dealt by attacks.
Specifies the scaling factor for damage taken when attacked.
Specifies the scaling factor for water consumption.
Specifies the scaling factor for food consumption.
Specifies the scaling factor for stamina consumption.
Specifies the scaling factor for health recovery.
Specifies the scaling factor for the harvest damage rate.
Specifies the multiplier for crafting bonus.

Defines the falling speed multiplier at which players starts taking fall damage. The falling speed is based on the time players spent in the air while having a negated Z axis velocity meaning that the higher this setting is, the longer players can fall without taking fall damage. For example, having it set to 0.1 means players will no longer survive a regular jump while having it set very high such as to 100.0 means players will survive a fall from the sky limit, etc. This setting doesn't affect the gravity scale of the players so there won't be any physics difference to the character movements.
Multiplied with base player Health stat.
Multiplied with base player Stamina stat.
Multiplied with base player Torpidity stat.
Multiplied with base player Oxygen stat.
Multiplied with base player Food stat.
Multiplied with base player Water stat.
Multiplied with base player Temperature stat.
Multiplied with base player Weight stat.
Multiplied with base player Melee Damage stat.
Multiplied with base player Speed stat.
Multiplied with base player Fortitude stat.
Multiplied with base player Crafting Speed stat.
Multiplier applied per point when Health Stat is upgraded.
Multiplier applied per point when Stamina Stat is upgraded.
Multiplier applied per point when Torpidity Stat is upgraded.
Multiplier applied per point when Oxygen Stat is upgraded.
Multiplier applied per point when Food Stat is upgraded.
Multiplier applied per point when Water Stat is upgraded.
Multiplier applied per point when Temperature Stat is upgraded.
Multiplier applied per point when Weight Stat is upgraded.

DisplayName: Per Level Melee Damage Stat Multiplier
Description: Multiplier applied per point when Melee Damage Stat is upgraded.
Multiplier applied per point when Speed Stat is upgraded.
Multiplier applied per point when Fortitude Stat is upgraded.

DisplayName: Per Level Crafting Speed Stat Multiplier
Description: Multiplier applied per point when Crafting Speed Stat is upgraded.
Specifies the scaling factor for dinosaur spawns. Higher values increase the number of dinosaurs spawned throughout the ARK.
Specifies the scaling factor for dinosaur taming speed. Higher values make taming faster.

Specifies the scaling factor for yields from all harvesting activities (chopping down trees, picking berries, carving carcasses, mining rocks, etc.). Higher values increase the amount of materials harvested with each strike.
Specifies the scaling factor for the respawn rate for resource nodes (trees, rocks, bushes, etc.). Lower values cause nodes to respawn more frequently.

Allow resources to regrow closer or farther away from players. Values higher than 1 increase the distance around players where resources are not allowed to grow back. Values between 0 and 1 will reduce it.

Allow resources to regrow closer or farther away from structures. Values higher than 1 increase the distance around structures where resources are not allowed to grow back. Values between 0 and 1 will reduce it.
Limit the damage caused by a dino to a resource for harvesting.
Limit the damage caused by a dino to a resource for harvesting.

Specifies the scaling factor for the "health" of items that can be harvested (trees, rocks, carcasses, etc.). Higher values increase the amount of damage (i.e. "number of strikes") such objects can withstand before being destroyed, which results in higher overall harvest yields.

Specifies the scaling factor for the passage of time in the ARK, controlling how often day changes to night and night changes to day. The default value 1 provides the same cycle speed as the singleplayer experience (and the official public servers). Values lower than 1 slow down the cycle; higher values accelerate it. Base time when value is 1 appears to be 1 minute real time equals approx. 28 minutes game time. Thus, for an approximate 24 hour day/night cycle in game, use .035 for the value.

Specifies the scaling factor for the passage of time in the ARK during the day. This value determines the length of each day, relative to the length of each night (as specified by Night Time Speed. Lowering this value increases the length of each day.

Specifies the scaling factor for the passage of time in the ARK during night time. This value determines the length of each night, relative to the length of each day (as specified by Day Time Speed. Lowering this value increases the length of each night.
If enabled, disables fog.
Scales the spoiling time of perishables globally. Higher values prolong the time.
Will clamp all spoiling times to the items' maximum spoiling times. Could potentially cause issues with Mods that alter spoiling time.
Scales the decomposition time of dropped items, loot bags etc. globally. Higher values prolong the decomposition time.
Scales the decomposition time of corpses, (player and dinosaur), globally. Higher values prolong the time.
Higher number decrease (by percentage) speed of crop decay in plots.
Higher number increases (by percentage) speed of crop growth.
Higher number increases (by percentage) time between eggs spawning / being laid.
Higher number decreases (by percentage) how frequently you can poop.
Higher number increase speed of hair growth.
A multiplier to scale the amount of XP earned from generic XP (automatic over time).
A multiplier to scale the amount of XP earned from crafting.
A multiplier to scale the amount of XP earned from harvesting.
A multiplier to scale the amount of XP earned from killing.
A multiplier to scale the amount of XP earned from SpecialEvents.
If enabled, allows for structures to clip into the terrain.

Specifies the scaling factor for the resistance to damage structures receive when attacked. The default value 1 provides normal damage. Higher values decrease resistance, increasing damage per attack. Lower values increase it, reducing damage per attack. A value of 0.5 results in a structure taking half damage while a value of 2.0 would result in a structure taking double damage.

Specifies the scaling factor for the damage structures deal with their attacks (i.e. spiked walls). The default value 1 provides normal damage. Higher values increase damage. Lower values decrease it.
Option for cooldown period on structure repair from the last time damaged. Set to 180 seconds by default, 0 to disable it.

Specifies the scaling factor for damage structures take within caves. The lower the value, the less damage the structure takes (i.e. setting to 1.0 will make structure built in or near a cave receive the same amount of damage as those built on the surface).
Specifies the maximum number of structures that can be constructed within a certain (currently hardcoded) range.
Higher number increases (on a percentage scale) max number of items place-able on saddles and rafts.
Specifies the maximum number of structures that can be constructed within a certain (currently hardcoded) range.
Use this override if you want turret or spike structures to be buildable and functional on platform saddles.
Quetz platforms will not allow any non-allied dino to base on them when they are flying. If you want your server to allow non-allied dinos to be able to stand on the Quetz platforms set this to true.
If enabled, allows building near supply drop points.
Disables the gradual (7 days) decay of player structures.
Specifies the scaling factor for the decay rate of player structures in PvE mode.
Enables auto destruction of old structures. Timer can be adjusted with "Auto Destroy Old Structures Multiplier". Structures will be destroyed once their "Demolish Timer" expires.

Server Option to allow Auto-Destroying Structures after sufficient "no nearby Tribe" time has passed (defined as a multiplier of the Allow Claim period). Useful for servers to clear off abandoned structures automatically over time if they wish. Set to 0 to disable.

You can launch an autodestroy enabled server with this opion to prevent any non-core/non-foundation structures from autodestroying (however they'll still get autodestroyed if a floor that they're on gets autodestroyed, of course). Official PvE Servers use this option.
If set, only unsnapped core structures will decay. Useful for eliminating lone pillar/foundation spam on PvP Servers.
Will decay unsnapped foundations/pillars at 5x speed.
Enable this option for a fixed constant decay period for "Fast Decay" structures (such as pillars or lone foundations).
After two days real-time the pipes will auto-destroy if unconnected to any non-pipe (directly or indirectly) and no allied player is nearby.
Enabling this will lock all item containers by default.
If enabled, allow spike walls to damage wild/riderless Dinos.

If enabled, will implement a retroactive turret hard limit. This affects, auto turrets, heavy turrets, tek turrets, and plant turrets. The limit is done at startup, if you find your turrets are randomly shutting off than you are over the limit and your turrets will continue randomly turning on and off until you are under the limit.
If enabled, limits the maximum allowed automated turrets (including Plant Species X) in a certain range.
If Enable Limit Turrets in Range, determines the area in which turrets are added towards the limit.
If Enable Limit Turrets in Range, determines the maximum number of turrets that are allowed in the area.
If enabled, disables the timer on the quick-pickup system.
Amount of time in seconds after placement that quick pickup is available.
Used to specify the quick-pickup hold duration, use 0 to disable and have instant pickup.
If false disables all of the new S+ structures (intended mainly for letting unofficials that want to keep using the S+ mod version to keep using that without a ton of extra duplicate structures).

DisplayName: Disable Building in Resource Rich Areas
Description: If enabled, completely disables building in specific resource-rich areas. Particularly useful to stop building on TheIsland around the major mountains.

DisplayName: Disable Building in Mission Areas (Genesis Part 1)
Description: If enabled, disables building in mission areas on the Genesis Part 1 map.
